N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.7 - Taxi-nonconcession

State Regulations
(a) General system. Nonconcession taxicabs shall operate from loading/unloading areas designated
for use by the general driving public. Said taxicabs may load/unload at the
airport only passengers whose transportation by such vehicle has been arranged
prior to such vehicle's entry onto airport property. (b) Rules applicable to nonconcessionaire
taxicabs. (1)

Vehicle appearance and running
condition. All nonconcessionaire taxicabs shall be kept clean and in first
class running condition. (2)

Cruising. Cruising on airport property is prohibited. (3)

Unauthorized parking. Drivers of
nonconcessionaire taxicabs shall not park in areas other than public parking
areas. (4)

Solicitation. Nonconcessionaire taxicab operators, or any driver or employee of such
operators, shall not engage in solicitation at the airport or in any way
collaborate with or encourage any other person to solicit business at the
airport on such operator's behalf. (5)

Improper conduct. Nonconcessionaire
taxicab operators, drivers, and employees shall not engage in improper conduct, including, but not limited to, boisterous conversation, profanity or fighting
at the airport, nor shall they provide misleading information concerning their
own or any other ground transportation service at the airport, or any other
service at the airport. (6)

Rates
and charges made available. Approved rates and charges for all
nonconcessionaire taxicabs shall be made available by the driver to any
passenger or potential passenger. This provision shall not be construed to
limit or conflict with paragraph (4) of this subdivision, which prohibits
solicitation at the airport. (7)

Vehicle requirements. Each taxicab shall at all times meet all requirements
imposed by the New York State Departments of Transportation and Motor Vehicles, in addition to all other applicable State, city and other local
ordinances. Notes
